title: Tools for Processing Rabies Lab Data for REDCap Upload
text: Introduction Workflow Installation Bug Reports Contributors

title: Tools for Processing Rabies Lab Data for REDCap Upload
text: rabvRedcapProcessing R package designed streamline cleaning, validation, formatting rabies lab metadata uploading REDCap. automates common curation tasks including: Matching data REDCap dictionary Handling common mismatches blank fields Recoding labels dictionary codes Creating REDCap-compatible repeat instruments (diagnostic sequencing forms) ensures data consistency across multiple labs minimizes manual formatting errors.

title: Tools for Processing Rabies Lab Data for REDCap Upload
text: typical workflow illustrated :

title: Tools for Processing Rabies Lab Data for REDCap Upload
text: Install directly GitHub using devtools:
code: # install.packages("devtools") # if not already installed devtools::install_github("RAGE-toolkit/rabvRedcapProcessing") library(rabvRedcapProcessing)

title: Tools for Processing Rabies Lab Data for REDCap Upload

what: Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict
title: Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict
text: function compares column names dataset variable names specified REDCap data dictionary. reports discrepancies adds missing dictionary variables dataset NA columns.

title: Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict
Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict
text: dayta data frame tibble representing dataset (e.g., REDCap export). dictPath string. Path REDCap data dictionary CSV format.

title: Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict
text: data frame columns defined dictionary. missing columns originally absent dataset added filled NA.

title: Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict
text: Useful ensuring consistency dataset REDCap project structure, especially importing data validating fields.

title: Compare REDCap Data Columns to Data Dictionary — compare_cols_to_dict

what: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
title: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
text: function derives overall diagnostic result based available test outcomes, following defined logical hierarchy across multiple diagnostic assays. designed work lateral flow test (LFT), RT-qPCR, hemi-nested PCR (HMPCR), direct fluorescent antibody test (FAT), direct rapid immunohistochemical test (DRIT).

title: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
text: df data frame containing combination following columns: lateral_flow_test: Categorical values (e.g., "Positive", "Negative"). rtqpcr: Numeric Ct values (character values coercible numeric). hmpcr_n405: HMPCR results (e.g., "Pos1", "Pos2", "Neg"). fat: FAT result. drit: DRIT result.

title: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
text: character vector ("Positive", "Negative", "Inconclusive", NA) representing overall diagnostic interpretation row.

title: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
text: function assumes categorical variables already cleaned recoded using standardized dictionary values (e.g., "Positive", "Negative", "Pos1", "Neg").

title: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
text: diagnostic result classified follows: Lateral flow test positive overrides results → returns "Positive". available test results "Negative", returns "Negative". FAT DRIT "Positive", returns "Positive". RT-qPCR Ct value < 32, returns "Positive". Ct value 32–36 (inclusive), returns "Inconclusive". Ct > 36, returns "Negative". HMPCR "Pos1" "Pos2", returns "Positive", "Negative" "Neg". valid results available, returns NA.

title: Classify Overall Diagnostic Result from Multiple Rabies Test Columns — create_diagnostic_result_rule
code: df <- tibble::tibble(   lateral_flow_test = c("Positive", "Negative", NA),   rtqpcr = c("30", "37", "34"),   hmpcr_n405 = c("Pos1", "Neg", "Neg"),   fat = c(NA, NA, "Positive"),   drit = c(NA, "Negative", NA) ) df$diagnosis <- create_diagnostic_result_rule(df)

what: Prepare Diagnostic and Sequencing REDCap Forms — final_processing
title: Prepare Diagnostic and Sequencing REDCap Forms — final_processing
text: function processes cleaned laboratory data splits two REDCap-ready data frames: one diagnostic form one sequencing form. assigns REDCap metadata fields like redcap_repeat_instrument, redcap_repeat_instance, redcap_access_group. ensures necessary fields exist based data dictionary fills missing values empty strings.

title: Prepare Diagnostic and Sequencing REDCap Forms — final_processing
Prepare Diagnostic and Sequencing REDCap Forms — final_processing
text: mydata data frame containing cleaned lab records. Must include sample_id column duplicate_id column repeat instance tracking. dictPath File path REDCap data dictionary (CSV format). access_group string specifying REDCap Data Access Group (DAG). Must one : "east_africa", "malawi", "nigeria", "peru", "philippines".

title: Prepare Diagnostic and Sequencing REDCap Forms — final_processing
text: named list two tibbles: diagnostic_form data frame ready REDCap import diagnostic repeat instrument. sequencing_form data frame ready REDCap import sequencing repeat instrument.

title: Prepare Diagnostic and Sequencing REDCap Forms — final_processing
text: function internally calls get_redcap_form_columns determine variables belong form. assigns redcap_repeat_instance duplicate_id column, sets repeat instrument name accordingly. Blank values replaced empty strings, expected REDCap import.

what: Extract REDCap Form Column Names from Data Dictionary — get_redcap_form_columns
title: Extract REDCap Form Column Names from Data Dictionary — get_redcap_form_columns
text: Parses REDCap data dictionary CSV file identify variables belong diagnostic sequencing forms. helps define expected structure export REDCap repeat instruments.

title: Extract REDCap Form Column Names from Data Dictionary — get_redcap_form_columns
Extract REDCap Form Column Names from Data Dictionary — get_redcap_form_columns
text: dictPath file path REDCap data dictionary (CSV format).

title: Extract REDCap Form Column Names from Data Dictionary — get_redcap_form_columns
text: named list three elements: diagnostic_columns character vector variable names diagnostic form. sequencing_columns character vector variable names sequencing form. Includes sample_id, redcap_repeat_instrument, redcap_repeat_instance. all_dict_cols character vector variables dictionary, including REDCap metadata columns.

what: Read and Parse REDCap Data Dictionary — read_and_parse_dict
title: Read and Parse REDCap Data Dictionary — read_and_parse_dict
text: function reads REDCap data dictionary (CSV format) parses "Choices" column create named list value-label pairs use data recoding. field "country", special parser allows country codes names map values.

title: Read and Parse REDCap Data Dictionary — read_and_parse_dict
Read and Parse REDCap Data Dictionary — read_and_parse_dict
text: dictPath Path REDCap data dictionary CSV file.

title: Read and Parse REDCap Data Dictionary — read_and_parse_dict
text: named list named vectors, list element corresponds field name, named vector maps value codes human-readable labels.

title: Read and Parse REDCap Data Dictionary — read_and_parse_dict
code: dicts <- read_and_parse_dict("data_dictionary.csv") #> Warning: cannot open file 'data_dictionary.csv': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection dicts[["sample_buffer"]] #> Error: object 'dicts' not found # > Glycerol-saline = Glycerol-saline # > RNAshield = RNAshield # > ...

what: Read and preprocess REDCap lab data — read_data
title: Read and preprocess REDCap lab data — read_data
text: function reads CSV file performs basic preprocessing: Assigns duplicate_id repeated sample_ids Parses ngs_rundate Date format using lubridate::dmy

title: Read and preprocess REDCap lab data — read_data
Read and preprocess REDCap lab data — read_data
text: filepath Path input CSV file

title: Read and preprocess REDCap lab data — read_data
text: tibble cleaned annotated data

title: Read and preprocess REDCap lab data — read_data
code: lab_data <- read_data("data/my_lab_records.csv") #> Error in read.csv(filepath, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) %>% dplyr::group_by(sample_id) %>%     dplyr::mutate(duplicate_id = dplyr::row_number(), ngs_rundate = lubridate::dmy(ngs_rundate)) %>%     dplyr::ungroup(): could not find function "%>%"

what: Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
title: Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
text: function maps human-readable values dataset back corresponding REDCap dictionary codes using named list field-specific dictionaries. useful REDCap exports manually curated data use labels, system requires coded values.

title: Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
text: dicts named list dictionaries (typically read_and_parse_dict), element corresponds REDCap field contains named character vector code--label mappings. dayta data frame tibble label values (converted back codes).

title: Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
text: tibble structure dayta, dictionary-mapped values replaced corresponding REDCap codes applicable.

title: Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
text: columns exist dayta dicts considered. unmatched values (either due typos, unexpected entries, blanks) flagged console output. applicable column: dictionary reversed (label → code) label data matched code labels matched (e.g. due typos blanks), warning message shown Unmatched values left NA output

title: Recode Human-Readable Labels to REDCap Dictionary Codes — recode_data
code: dicts <- list(   fat = c("0" = "Negative", "1" = "Positive"),   sample_buffer = c("0" = "Glycerol-saline", "1" = "RNAlater") )  df <- tibble::tibble(   fat = c("Positive", "Negative", "Unknown"),   sample_buffer = c("RNAlater", "Glycerol-saline", "") )  recoded <- recode_data(dicts, df) #> ⚠️ Some values could not be matched to dictionary codes. #> → Please review and replace these in your data to match allowed dictionary values. #>  - `fat`: Unknown #>  - `sample_buffer`: contains blanks print(recoded) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   fat   sample_buffer #>   <chr> <chr>         #> 1 1     1             #> 2 0     0             #> 3 NA    NA

what: Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels
title: Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels
text: Checks whether values specified column dataset present REDCap dictionary definitions. Returns (invisibly) values found dictionary prints message review.

title: Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels
Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels
text: dayta data frame tibble containing dataset checked. dicts named list dictionaries created REDCap dictionary (e.g., using read_and_parse_dict()), element corresponds coded field maps value labels codes. col_to_check string indicating column name dayta check dictionary.

title: Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels
text: Invisibly returns character vector values listed dictionary column. Also prints messages console user feedback.

title: Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels
text: function helpful validating categorical variables predefined coding (e.g., gender, yes/), ensuring observed values match expected dictionary labels. optionally notifies user fallback categories like "" "Unknown" present dictionary.

title: Scan for Mismatched Categorical Values Against REDCap Dictionary — scan_mismatched_levels

what: Tidy Up Lab Data Values Before Recoding — tidy_up_values
title: Tidy Up Lab Data Values Before Recoding — tidy_up_values
text: function standardizes common mismatches lab data align REDCap dictionary values. harmonizes tissue types, buffer names, test results (FAT, dRIT, lateral flow), PCR results. also sanitizes sample_id remove special characters (+, &) may break REDCap uploads.

title: Tidy Up Lab Data Values Before Recoding — tidy_up_values
Tidy Up Lab Data Values Before Recoding — tidy_up_values
text: df data frame containing raw lab data.

title: Tidy Up Lab Data Values Before Recoding — tidy_up_values
text: cleaned data frame harmonized categorical values.

title: Tidy Up Lab Data Values Before Recoding — tidy_up_values
